function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Fear of infection with COVID-19 leading to a shift from public transport to private vehicles.","Impact":"Decreased use of public transport and increased traffic congestion.","Mitigation":"Improving safety measures in public transport and promoting alternative sustainable modes of transportation.","Technologies":"Contactless payment systems, air filtration systems, and real-time occupancy tracking.","People":"Public transport users, city residents, and commuters.","Owner":"Public transport authorities, city governments, and urban planners."},{"Description":"Feeling less safe using public transport, affecting attitudes and habits towards public transport use.","Impact":"Reduced reliance on public transport and increased demand for private vehicle use.","Mitigation":"Enhancing safety measures, promoting public transport as a safe option, and improving communication on health and safety protocols.","Technologies":"Surveillance systems, sanitation stations, and public communication platforms.","People":"Public transport users, city residents, and commuters.","Owner":"Public transport authorities, city governments, and urban planners."},{"Description":"Factors affecting comfort and safety in public transport during the pandemic, including fear of other passengers not following hygienic measures and tidiness of the vehicle.","Impact":"Decreased satisfaction and confidence in public transport, leading to further decline in ridership.","Mitigation":"Enforcing hygiene protocols, maintaining cleanliness, and promoting responsible passenger behavior.","Technologies":"Sanitization equipment, contactless interfaces, and occupancy monitoring systems.","People":"Public transport users, city residents, and commuters.","Owner":"Public transport authorities, city governments, and urban planners."}]}
